description: Establishes the baseline at the appropriate project cycle control gates and manages the system configuration to control changes from the baseline.
indicator: Has awareness of configuration management tools and the purpose and process of configuration management.

description: Establishes the baseline at the appropriate project cycle control gates and manages the system configuration to control changes from the baseline.
indicator: Displays solid skills in configuration management sufficient to support establishment of the baseline at each project control gate and to assist in maintaining the configuration change control process in the most effective manner.

description: Establishes the baseline at the appropriate project cycle control gates and manages the system configuration to control changes from the baseline.
indicator: Demonstrates strong ability to establish the baseline at each project control gate accurately and to maintain the configuration change control process in the most effective manner.

description: Establishes the baseline at the appropriate project cycle control gates and manages the system configuration to control changes from the baseline.
indicator: Leverages thorough knowledge of configuration management best practices in the industry sufficient to influence a stakeholder’s selection of the configuration management approach in order to increase the system’s efficiency and effectiveness.

description: Translates system architecture and software designs into a data architecture to be used by the software. Installs, configures, tunes and operates data storage and access mechanisms to support the solution's data architecture and performance requirements.
indicator: Knows basic database concepts, normalization, ACID, transactions and can write simple queries.

description: Translates system architecture and software designs into a data architecture to be used by the software. Installs, configures, tunes and operates data storage and access mechanisms to support the solution's data architecture and performance requirements.
indicator: Able to design normalized database schemas, keeping in mind the queries that will have to be run. Proficient in use of views, stored procedures, triggers, and user defined types. Begins to gain experience in measuring performance of queries.

description: Translates system architecture and software designs into a data architecture to be used by the software. Installs, configures, tunes and operates data storage and access mechanisms to support the solution's data architecture and performance requirements.
indicator: Able to conduct basic database administration, performance optimization, and index optimization, as well as write advanced queries. Understands how data is stored internally, how indexes are stored internally, etc.

description: Translates system architecture and software designs into a data architecture to be used by the software. Installs, configures, tunes and operates data storage and access mechanisms to support the solution's data architecture and performance requirements.
indicator: Able to integrate previously disparate databases or new data management technologies and software engineering tools to dramatically enhance a program’s reporting capabilities and create consolidated master data.

description: Employs a variety of methods to estimate size, effort, duration, defects and uncertainty in software activities, and provides defensible justifications for these estimates.
indicator: Uses requirements to effectively plan and estimate required effort, size and/ or other appropriate attributes for software within a limited scope.

description: Employs a variety of methods to estimate size, effort, duration, defects and uncertainty in software activities, and provides defensible justifications for these estimates.
indicator: Estimates software effort, size, and/ or other appropriate attributes for software in large systems. Has working knowledge of both top-down and bottoms-up estimation processes, tools, and methodologies to collaboratively develop and cross-check team’s estimates.

description: Employs a variety of methods to estimate size, effort, duration, defects and uncertainty in software activities, and provides defensible justifications for these estimates.
indicator: Exhibits in-depth knowledge of how to estimate software effort, size and/ or other appropriate attributes for software in very large and complex systems. Leads teams responsible for estimating large software projects. Utilizes historical analogous programs to decompose tasks and generate estimates with justification. Participates in selection of software estimating tools.

description: Employs a variety of methods to estimate size, effort, duration, defects and uncertainty in software activities, and provides defensible justifications for these estimates.
indicator: Leverages deep understanding of both top-down and bottoms-up software estimating methodologies to perform estimates of the most complex systems. Validates estimates provided by the team. Recommends appropriate Leidos estimating techniques and tools. Participates in industry-wide forums associated with software estimating. Capable of applying statistical techniques to the estimating process.

description: Researches and translates understanding of customer needs into appropriate design and solutions that enhance the user experience.
indicator: Demonstrates knowledge of usability practices and human factors to develop mock ups of user interfaces.

description: Researches and translates understanding of customer needs into appropriate design and solutions that enhance the user experience.
indicator: Conducts appropriate user centered design techniques through an iterative process; modifies and adapts methods as appropriate to address specific design challenges.

description: Researches and translates understanding of customer needs into appropriate design and solutions that enhance the user experience.
indicator: Exhibits broad knowledge of usability and user interface technologies to optimize user experience through software development. Demonstrates success developing complex user interfaces.

description: Researches and translates understanding of customer needs into appropriate design and solutions that enhance the user experience.
indicator: Pioneers new methodologies and customer engagement to create optimal desirable user experience within the system environment.

description: Analyzes and predicts system performance throughout the lifecycle.
indicator: Has awareness of performance analysis techniques and the impact of conducting such analyses in meeting users’ objectives.

description: Analyzes and predicts system performance throughout the lifecycle.
indicator: Leverages solid knowledge and experience in performance analysis to appropriately use techniques and measures to analyze and predict the performance of the system and its conformance to requirements.

description: Analyzes and predicts system performance throughout the lifecycle.
indicator: Utilizes strong experience in performance analysis to design and conduct complex analyses throughout the lifecycle and tie technical performance measures to other project performance metrics, ensuring implementation of the system will meet users’ objectives.

description: Analyzes and predicts system performance throughout the lifecycle.
indicator: Leverages a deep understanding of performance analysis methodologies to set protocols, guidelines, and complex processes, ensuring the implementation systems meet and exceed all the users objective.

description: Utilizes various programming languages and effectively operates build tools to develop algorithms that automate solutions to implement design which satisfies customer requirements
indicator: Demonstrates programming skills to develop new or maintain existing software applications/ systems within a limited scope.

description: Utilizes various programming languages and effectively operates build tools to develop algorithms that automate solutions to implement design which satisfies customer requirements
indicator: Proficient in programming skills. Capable of developing and/ or maintaining software using a variety of software development tools. Develops small to medium-sized software systems. Begins to gain experience measuring personal software development productivity.

description: Utilizes various programming languages and effectively operates build tools to develop algorithms that automate solutions to implement design which satisfies customer requirements
indicator: Exhibits broad knowledge of established programming techniques and tools to develop new and/ or maintain existing software. Participates in the selection of software languages best suited for the architecture of a system/ application. Understands personal software development productivity. Develops software for large systems.

description: Utilizes various programming languages and effectively operates build tools to develop algorithms that automate solutions to implement design which satisfies customer requirements
indicator: Exhibits in-depth understanding of programming technologies available in the market in order to provide the most efficient means of implementing the needed functionality. Applies statistical techniques in performing individual programming activities. Recommends programming techniques and tools for Leidos.

description: Analyzes and manages requirements to ensure scope management and quality standards.
indicator: Reviews and analyses user and software requirements. Familiar with multiple requirements techniques and notations used in requirements analysis. Performs requirements analysis on limited-size systems. Understands that changes to requirements must be approved by project management.

description: Analyzes and manages requirements to ensure scope management and quality standards.
indicator: Applies a strong understanding of wide range of system and software requirements analysis techniques and notations. Ensures stakeholder requirements match software requirements. Performs requirements analysis on relatively complex systems. Implements requirements management processes on projects.

description: Analyzes and manages requirements to ensure scope management and quality standards.
indicator: Applies broad understanding of a large variety of system and software requirements analysis techniques. Performs system and software requirements analysis on large and complex systems and components. Participates in selection of requirements analysis tools within the company. Defines requirements management processes on projects. Participates in requirements change review and approval.

description: Analyzes and manages requirements to ensure scope management and quality standards.
indicator: Leverages in-depth knowledge of implementing a large variety of system and software requirements analysis techniques. Performs requirements analysis on very large and complex systems. Determines requirements analysis tools for Leidos. Participates in industry-wide forums in the area of requirements analysis. Capable of applying statistical techniques to requirements analysis processes. Defines Leidos-way for requirements management processes. Participates in decision to evolve Leidos’ requirements management processes.

description: Gains knowledge of stakeholder needs and elicits requirements. Validates requirements with stakeholders.
indicator: Asks meaningful and appropriate questions through requirement gathering sessions to understand and document stakeholder requirements for specific scope area within a system.

description: Gains knowledge of stakeholder needs and elicits requirements. Validates requirements with stakeholders.
indicator: Leverages working knowledge of the requirements development process to elicit and validate stakeholder requirements of basic systems and convert stakeholder needs into software requirements, using the appropriate software tools. Is familiar with applying group development sessions.

description: Gains knowledge of stakeholder needs and elicits requirements. Validates requirements with stakeholders.
indicator: Applies in-depth knowledge of requirements development process to lead complex requirement elicitation sessions for large-scale systems. Translates complex stakeholder requirements into software requirements. Is experienced in leading group development requirements sessions.

description: Gains knowledge of stakeholder needs and elicits requirements. Validates requirements with stakeholders.
indicator: Demonstrates expansive skills in leading highly complex and ambiguous requirement elicitation sessions and ensures that requirements are consistent with overall system architecture. Represents Leidos as an expert in industry wide forums related to requirements elicitation and validation. Determines appropriate requirements processes within Leidos. Capable of applying statistical techniques to the requirements elicitation process.

description: Applies accepted risk management approaches in order to identify, analyze, mitigate, track, document, and communicate risks. Manages project processes so the system meets an acceptable risk profile.
indicator: Shows awareness of risk management approaches to identify and track risk and use risk reserves.

description: Applies accepted risk management approaches in order to identify, analyze, mitigate, track, document, and communicate risks. Manages project processes so the system meets an acceptable risk profile.
indicator: Shows working ability in analyzing and tracking risks and the status of mitigation while logging risk and related performance.

description: Applies accepted risk management approaches in order to identify, analyze, mitigate, track, document, and communicate risks. Manages project processes so the system meets an acceptable risk profile.
indicator: Applies strong skills to develop large and complex risk management programs as well as interact with stakeholders and subcontractor teams to keep them appraised of potential risks.

description: Applies accepted risk management approaches in order to identify, analyze, mitigate, track, document, and communicate risks. Manages project processes so the system meets an acceptable risk profile.
indicator: Demonstrates in-depth knowledge by reducing risk in high risk projects, and through interactions between customers and key stakeholders to ensure systems remain on track.

description: Designs and implements software/ solutions that adhere to information security best practices. Uses accepted tools and techniques to identify security vulnerabilities and weaknesses, and manages the communication and closure of these issues.
indicator: Demonstrates basic knowledge of software security processes and practices to ensure data and information security.

description: Designs and implements software/ solutions that adhere to information security best practices. Uses accepted tools and techniques to identify security vulnerabilities and weaknesses, and manages the communication and closure of these issues.
indicator: Understands best practices in software design that reduce the likelihood of security threats. Able to use dependable security tools and reliable software packages/ applications.

description: Designs and implements software/ solutions that adhere to information security best practices. Uses accepted tools and techniques to identify security vulnerabilities and weaknesses, and manages the communication and closure of these issues.
indicator: Drives security strategies that are forward-thinking and successfully anticipates potential security risks that could result in loss or misuse of data and information.

description: Designs and implements software/ solutions that adhere to information security best practices. Uses accepted tools and techniques to identify security vulnerabilities and weaknesses, and manages the communication and closure of these issues.
indicator: n-depth knowledge of data security with a proven track record in the prevention and resolution of security threats and application of security risk mitigations. Participates in industry-wide forums associated with security practices.

description: Creates a software design that satisfies customer requirements. Uses defined representations to communicate that design to others and to enable verification of its completeness and correctness.
indicator: Demonstrates capability of designing software architecture and detailed software design for software units of a limited scope.

description: Creates a software design that satisfies customer requirements. Uses defined representations to communicate that design to others and to enable verification of its completeness and correctness.
indicator: Develops software architecture for small to medium-sized software systems. Familiar with and can apply a variety of software design techniques and notations. Selects software design approach for small to medium-sized projects.

description: Creates a software design that satisfies customer requirements. Uses defined representations to communicate that design to others and to enable verification of its completeness and correctness.
indicator: Develops software architecture for large and complex systems. Is intimately familiar with at least one software design techniques and notations. Coaches and mentors fellow team members in software design.

description: Creates a software design that satisfies customer requirements. Uses defined representations to communicate that design to others and to enable verification of its completeness and correctness.
indicator: Develops software architecture for very large and complex software systems. Significant experience in applying a large variety of software design techniques and notations. Participates in industry-wide forums to help evolve software design methodology. Capable of applying statistical techniques to the software design process. Leverages expansive knowledge of tools to understand complexities and dependencies of software components.

description: Ensures software quality and requirements compliance through various levels of testing, including unit tests that conform to project standards for implementation style, coverage, reporting and frequency of execution.
indicator: Has basic understanding of a variety of software unit-level testing techniques. Integrates and tests software units into engineering baselines.

description: Ensures software quality and requirements compliance through various levels of testing, including unit tests that conform to project standards for implementation style, coverage, reporting and frequency of execution.
indicator: Designs the software test approach for small to medium sized projects. Conducts software unit, integration, and software system tests. Understands how to use requirements to develop software integration and system tests. Has basic understanding of software test tools.

description: Ensures software quality and requirements compliance through various levels of testing, including unit tests that conform to project standards for implementation style, coverage, reporting and frequency of execution.
indicator: Designs and implements the software test approach for large to very large-sized projects. Leads software test groups to perform software testing on projects. Selects software test tools to be used on projects. Works with requirements developers to ensure requirements are testable. Develops tests from software system requirements.

description: Ensures software quality and requirements compliance through various levels of testing, including unit tests that conform to project standards for implementation style, coverage, reporting and frequency of execution.
indicator: Possesses deep understanding of software and system test techniques. Participates in developing Leidos-way software test techniques and tools. Participates in industry-wide forums associated with software testing techniques and tools. Capable of applying statistical techniques to the software testing process.

description: Performs structured trade studies to enable sound technical decisions among alternative design or process elements based on mission needs, risk, cost, technical attributes or other criteria.
indicator: Shows awareness of trade study tools and techniques and how these contribute to sound technical decision making.

description: Performs structured trade studies to enable sound technical decisions among alternative design or process elements based on mission needs, risk, cost, technical attributes or other criteria.
indicator: Utilizes working knowledge of decision analysis to support trade studies at all stages of development in order to evaluate system design alternatives and identify the best alternative based on the established criteria.

description: Performs structured trade studies to enable sound technical decisions among alternative design or process elements based on mission needs, risk, cost, technical attributes or other criteria.
indicator: Applies strong skills in decision analysis and trade studies to design rigorous trade studies and use them to support effective decision making.

description: Performs structured trade studies to enable sound technical decisions among alternative design or process elements based on mission needs, risk, cost, technical attributes or other criteria.
indicator: Is considered a master in evaluating highly technical design and the application of systems engineering processes throughout the lifecycle, ensuring the soundness of technical decisions.

description: Plans and oversees technical processes. Converts contract requirements into executable technical plans and ensures that they are implemented to satisfy customer needs.
indicator: Participates in small scope software planning activities to develop small project plans, schedules, and budgets. Works with other software engineers to monitor planned vs. actual software project management parameters.

description: Plans and oversees technical processes. Converts contract requirements into executable technical plans and ensures that they are implemented to satisfy customer needs.
indicator: Develops project planning documentation, schedules, and budgets for small to medium-sized projects. Is familiar with a variety of software lifecycles including Iterative, Evolutionary and Agile. Familiar with Earned Value. Leads a small team of software engineers. Monitors planned vs. actual project planning parameters and develops status reports.

description: Plans and oversees technical processes. Converts contract requirements into executable technical plans and ensures that they are implemented to satisfy customer needs.
indicator: Develops project planning documentation, schedules, and budgets for large and complex projects. Is very familiar with many software lifecycles and picks an appropriate software lifecycle for the project. Leads a large team of software engineers. Designs the metrics monitoring system for software projects. Performs software project monitoring. Is aware of and may apply statistical techniques for monitoring software project status.

description: Plans and oversees technical processes. Converts contract requirements into executable technical plans and ensures that they are implemented to satisfy customer needs.
indicator: Has in-depth understanding of multiple technical disciplines to ensure successful and timely implementation of technical plans by allocating optimal resources and mitigating risks while improving project performance. Has deep understanding of how statistical techniques can be applied to software projects. Capable of applying statistical techniques to the software project planning and monitoring processes.

description: Collaborates with team members to ensure that all final work outputs are up to par with existing standards for quality and effectiveness.
indicator: Demonstrates awareness of company-wide and software engineering-specific quality standards. Proactively and regularly solicits feedback and input from more senior team members to ensure that own work products meet all applicable standards and expectations.

description: Collaborates with team members to ensure that all final work outputs are up to par with existing standards for quality and effectiveness.
indicator: Utilizes existing quality standards and foundational technical knowledge to conduct peer reviews of fellow team members’ work. Coaches, mentors, and provides constructive feedback to junior team members on methods for producing high quality work products.

description: Collaborates with team members to ensure that all final work outputs are up to par with existing standards for quality and effectiveness.
indicator: Applies in-depth knowledge of software requirements and designs to standardize quality procedures. Ensures that team members are familiar with current methodologies in order to ensure team outputs meet expectations. Able to lead teams focused on Joint Application Development (JAD).

description: Collaborates with team members to ensure that all final work outputs are up to par with existing standards for quality and effectiveness.
indicator: Leverages expansive experience in software engineering to design and execute team development efforts. Establishes protocols and guidelines to help guarantee that team members understand quality standards and have access to peer review and feedback from more experienced colleagues.

description: Manages testing and evaluation. Develops test plans and procedures, performs the test, and analyzes and reports the results.
indicator: Shows awareness of test and evaluation procedures that assess whether systems are performing to meet specifications.

description: Manages testing and evaluation. Develops test plans and procedures, performs the test, and analyzes and reports the results.
indicator: Exhibits solid skills in supporting the implementation of test and evaluation plans and proceduresthat assess whether systems are performing to meet specifications.

description: Manages testing and evaluation. Develops test plans and procedures, performs the test, and analyzes and reports the results.
indicator: Utilizes broad skills to implement test and evaluation plans and proceduresthat assess whether systems are performing to meet specifications.

description: Manages testing and evaluation. Develops test plans and procedures, performs the test, and analyzes and reports the results.
indicator: Applies expansive knowledge of test and evaluation strategies and techniques to guide and coach the team in testing and evaluating large and highly complex systems.
